html escaping
linebreak
Added goUp
1.18 release notes
1.17 release notes
Link my name to my janky homepage.
go fmt
fix for malformed message test
removing swp file

eradicate parens
tests running but not all passing after merge
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into more_tests
clean up logging
Merge branch 'more_tests' of github.com:ilya/coinkit into more_tests
tests for bad messages being sent to the server
tests for the server to see if can handle bad messages
oops, forgot the git workflow. removing test for another pull request later.
fix go style
test that the server is ok with unrecognized messages
make my refactor compatible with master and fix test breakage due to bad import
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit
test that everything dies if port taken
dumb test 2
dumb test
clean ugly whitespace messing up vim
add tag to log, i think you meant to do this
new util to grab env var
test running script that can toggle between default and long loops in fuzz tests
brevity
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into big_ballots2
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into big_ballots2
accumulate to get the real max n. also account for incrementing ballots correctly.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into big_ballots2
cleanup
working fix+test for ddos
add test that fails on DDoS
WIP fix for DDoS. not sure if right approach.
remove clause in if statement that is redundant with prior logic
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into chrome
README for chrome/
more specific printf and small fix
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/lacker/coinkit into chrome
go fmt cclient
remove foo
proof of concept for chrome extension
Apply saving of scroll positions to all tabs, no matter how they are closed.
Don't put the new tab page into the tab restoration queue.
Update the README a bit.
Fix a bug where the second modifier key was ignored (due to else-if's). This closes issue 97.
Some minor style changes.
Some 1.16 notes in the README.
Fix a bug where we weren't properly ignoring keystrokes that are just metakeys.

Fix a bunch of key handling related bugs in one swoop. 

We were incorrectly generating valid first keys and completion keys for <c-x> type commands. This closes issue #85 and the alt+d override issue.
Key Mapping - Don't try to parse key mappings unless there's actually something saved.
Key Mapping - Initial support. Basics work.
Key Mapping - Create an available commands structure and factor out the key registry into commands.js
Update command listing with <c-e>, <c-y>.
Bring the CREDITS file up to date.
Updated README & a new CREDITS file to keep track of contributors.
Cutting 1.11 release. New README & manifest.
'yy' instead of 'y' for the copy url to clipboard command.
Update README with Linux support.
Missing newline, again.
Literal asterisks.
Get rid of chrome.tabs.getSelected in getCurrentTabUrl.
Refresh the completion keys on every keystroke sent to the background page. This is the first pass at fixing issue #34.
Hook up the content script to completion keys. Still need to fetch an updated completionKey list after every key stroke.
Add infrastructure to handle sendRequest calls in the background page.
Bring up insert mode if the user opens up the native find interface. Closes issue #32.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Don't test the focusNode if there isn't one.
Enter insert mode if the content script loads with a text input already focused before we can add event handlers (e.g. google). Also blur the text box if the user exits insert mode. Closes #4.
Implement 'gf' -- toggle view source for the current page.
Keep tab queue per-window instead of globally. This mirrors behavior in both Vim and Vimperator. Closes #2.
Implement forward and back in history.

Add a workaround for a chrome/webkit bug that gives back bad scrollTop data:
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=2891

There may still be another bug or some trickery needed to get proper scrollTop values all the time.
Implement basic h,j,k,l navigation and remove the unnecessary registry in the content script.
Simplify the registry in background_page a bit.
First pass at a better framework for mapping keys to commands.
bumping readme
bumping to 1.38

Fix regression in shuffleHints()
README updates

vomnibar: New tabs for 'O' and 'B'

cutting 1.30 release

Allow Tab/Shift-Tab to select items in bookmark dialog

Merge pull request #406 from ohnishiakira/detectImageMap

fixes #393: detect Image map in hint mode

Merge pull request #395 from dgl/countnav

Use count if provided in back/forward navigation

Merge pull request #379 from has2k1/patch-1

Prevent bookmark completion box from overflowing.
Cutting 1.29

Merge pull request #372 from pandeiro/master

Add link-copying functionality to linkHints mode

Merge pull request #357 from rgsmith1980/master

GitHub logo hinting

Merge pull request #341 from mcantor/master

Make "gf" (nextFrame) work with count given (eg. 2gf)
Bump version to 1.27
Update 1.27 notes in README
Don't gobble escape unless we're on a Google domain -- for the good people at Quora.
Don't let Google Instant grab focus on keys that are part of a multiple key shortcut. Fixes #319.
Simplified the completion keys logic and fixed a discovered bug regarding refreshing completion keys when a new mapping is saved.
README started for 1.27
Fix a crucial bug with insufficient padding of link hints.
Added a section on key mappings to the README. Also updated and cleaned it up in general.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:philc/vimium
Cutting 1.26, will release tomorrow.
README for 1.26
Remove <c-d>, <c-f> default mappings and related because they cause too many problems for people.
cutting 1.25, unfortunately
Change the font size on the help dialog to 11 temporarily because, without more refactoring, the command view in the options page with advanced enabled is way too large.

Make the options page use the normal help dialog code path when its showing the command view. This fixes a regression with the new advanced commands functionality -- the command view wasn't showing at all.
cut 1.24 release for bugfix
fix default fetching with excludedUrls
cut 1.23 release for bugfix
Fix a bug where you can't save empty fields if there's a non-empty default. Also made the option saving code more robust to similar scenarios
fix some incorrect bindings in the readme
another readme update
fix a readme mistake with the open/close tab
readme updates for 1.22 release
fix a bug with zoomReset
added hogelog to credits
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/hogelog/vimium into hogelog-master
Doc updates
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/stchris/vimium into stchris-master
Expand the XPath used to find DOM elements for focusInput(). Closes #250.
Fixed a regression with completion key logic after the introduction of frame support. Closes #249.
Start README section for 1.22
Added default exclude URLs. This is a huge pain point for users and it just makes sense at this point to provide some defaults.
Merge branch 'fix-c-f' of https://github.com/drizzd/vimium into drizzd-fix-c-f
Fix an excluded URLs regression due to frame support.
Cutting 1.20 release
Small bugfix in hideHelpDialog() -- thanks walm.
Make 'gi' compatible with repetition, i.e. 5gi will focus the fifth input box on the page.
README updates

Merge branch 'branden'

	CREDITS
	lib/keyboardUtils.js
Cut the 1.19 release which has the script tag bug fix.
Add icons to the manifest and to the repo.
add goUp to the readme command listing - this needs to be deprecated for something auto generated
Fix some markdown formatting in the README.
README updates for 1.18
Missing newline in the README.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Cutting 1.17
Add new link hints method to README.
Small styling change on the options page.
Updated README with unmapAll.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Real names are always good.
Move some code into init() so that it's clear that it executes once and is part of initialization.
Add more robust support for keeping track of positions/windows when tabs are moved within or between windows.
whitespace
Update README and add int3 to CREDITS.
Avoid creating a separate tabQueueEntry object when we can just reuse the object used in openTabs.
Clean up naming/style in the previous commit and small bugs.
Fix chaining of previousTab/nextTab commands. This closes #93.
Adding Bill to CREDITS.
Fix some swapped descriptions in commands.js
Clean up the dialog code in options.html to be more generic.
Add a note to the README about key remapping.
Bump version numbers to 1.16 in preparation for release.
Add a dialog to show all available commands for key mappings under the options page.
Handle shift for non-letter keys that are affected by the WebKit bug under Windows/Linux. This closes issue #84.
Fix a br tag.
Key Mapping - Reparse the mappings whenever a new value is saved in the options page.
Key Mapping - Add some descriptions for commands, to be exposed in the options page.
Key Mapping - Add support for comments in the mappings text.
Key Mapping - Add option textbox and text to the options page.
Cutting 1.15 release
Cut the 1.13 release
Bump version to 1.1 -- cutting a release for the directory.
Wording change in release notes.
Actual markdown for 1.1 release notes.
Get rid of chrome.tabs.getSelected in checkKeyQueue.
Add logic to the background page to calculate the keys that will complete a valid command given the current key queue.
Missing return statement.
Expanded the README a bit with keyboard bindings and other information.
Switch up the scroll restoration logic for in place search to occur before the real search.
Cooked up some in-place finding. The search results won't jump around the page until you hit enter and use 'n' or 'N'. While you type the first matching result will stick. Closes #24.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium

Enable non-alphanumeric characters in find queries. Closes #14.

Fix involved two things: (1) unblocking the display of real spaces in the HUD when mixed in with the fake spaces intentionally inserted, (2) fixing our keydown handler to understand the scenario when we need to use the unicode keyIdentifier.
Add extra sanity checking to partially address issue #12 -- insert mode detection throws javascript error.
Minor cleanup per Phil's comments.
Case-insensitive search.
First pass at find interface. Still needs some UI love and a highlight-all feature (maybe).
Move the HUD over to the right for the time being -- it gets covered up by the status bar on the left.
First pass at a settings page. Hooked up scrollStepSize as our first setting.
Refactor a bit to use new isInputOrText() function.
Move processing of 'i' command out into background command processor. Closes #5.
Get rid of the toolstrip for now.
README
String together some callbacks to properly execute multiple actions that are asynchronous. For example, there was a race between the tab remove call and the selection of a new tab.
Implement basic tab restore functionality (the 'u' command).
Reload.
Clean up some code that's now unnecessary.
Add tab create and remove to the new system, disable the old system.
1.32 version bump
README update
A little cleanup.
Added some docs for the latest pull request.
Add scrollFullPageUp to command listings.
Release 1.21
Updating the README with all the latest commands.

Fixed Vimium getting overridden by Google Instant Search.

May be subject to internationalization issues still but it's much better than before.
Tiny style fixup.
README updates for 'gi'
Change default keys for scrollToLeft and scrollToRight to be zH, zL respectively.
remove spammy console.log i committed by accident
Start 1.20 release notes and add shift key toggling for link hints.
Add icons to the README for 1.19
Added Jez's new goUp function to the README and to the command reference.
Typos.
manifest update for 1.18
Don't show the options page link on the command listings dialog.
Add showHelp to the command listings / help dialog.
Add an unmapAll command to the remapping interface. This closes #116.
Add knuton to CREDITS.
Adding tsigo to CREDITS.
whitespace
Small modification to Bill's fix.
Oops, fixing my refactor of the modifier key handling.
Refactor a bit for simplicity.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Update the README with modifier key definitions.
Refresh completion keys on all tabs and associated data structures after key mappings are saved.
Fix a bug where if you add a mapping, save, and then remove it -- it won't get actually unmapped.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Remove some key bindings that are broken in the current default mappings.
Adding rodimius to CREDITS.
Cut 1.14 release
Cut 1.14 release
Typo on the settings page. Thanks DFectuoso.
<c-e>, <c-y> in release notes.
Fix up the c-[ patch a bit.
Bring the README fully up to date.
Added command reference to the settings page. Closes issue #56.
Added some running release notes to the README so we can keep track of what's going into the next release. Easier than summarizing after the fact.
Implement 'y' -- yank (copy) the current tab's url to the clipboard.
Update README to reflect additional keybindings for next/prev tab.
Add some UI feedback in the HUD if there are no exact matches for the current search. Fixes #42.
Missing newline necessary for proper Markdown.
Add 1.1 release notes to the README.
Expose completion keys via sendRequest interface in background page.
Prevent the space bar from scrolling us if we're in find mode.
Simplify our key handling further.

Refactor the command parser to not store invalid keys in the two-key buffer. Also, if the second key is itself a valid first key or a standalone command, keep it or execute it accordingly. Closes #20.
Fix bug where find mode HUD matched its own searches.
semicolon
Some cleanup.
Save scroll position for removed tabs.
Small bugfix for bug introduced in last commit. Don't take any keystrokes besides ESC if insertMode is on.
Cleanup the code in the content script a bit.
Initial support for counts. Commands like '5j' and '5t' work pretty well. '5d' and '5u' need some love.

Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Remove some key bindings that are broken in the current default mappings.
Some 1.16 notes in the README.
Handle shift for non-letter keys that are affected by the WebKit bug under Windows/Linux. This closes issue #84.
Fix a bug where we weren't properly ignoring keystrokes that are just metakeys.

Fix a bunch of key handling related bugs in one swoop. 

We were incorrectly generating valid first keys and completion keys for <c-x> type commands. This closes issue #85 and the alt+d override issue.
Fix a br tag.
Adding rodimius to CREDITS.
Key Mapping - Don't try to parse key mappings unless there's actually something saved.
Key Mapping - Reparse the mappings whenever a new value is saved in the options page.

Key Mapping - Add support for comments in the mappings text.
Key Mapping - Initial support. Basics work.

Implement 'y' -- yank (copy) the current tab's url to the clipboard.

Get rid of chrome.tabs.getSelected in getCurrentTabUrl.
Get rid of chrome.tabs.getSelected in checkKeyQueue.
Refresh the completion keys on every keystroke sent to the background page. This is the first pass at fixing issue #34.
Hook up the content script to completion keys. Still need to fetch an updated completionKey list after every key stroke.
Expose completion keys via sendRequest interface in background page.
Add logic to the background page to calculate the keys that will complete a valid command given the current key queue.
Add infrastructure to handle sendRequest calls in the background page.
Missing return statement.
Bring up insert mode if the user opens up the native find interface. Closes issue #32.
Expanded the README a bit with keyboard bindings and other information.
Switch up the scroll restoration logic for in place search to occur before the real search.
Prevent the space bar from scrolling us if we're in find mode.
Cooked up some in-place finding. The search results won't jump around the page until you hit enter and use 'n' or 'N'. While you type the first matching result will stick. Closes #24.
Simplify our key handling further.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium

Enable non-alphanumeric characters in find queries. Closes #14.

Fix involved two things: (1) unblocking the display of real spaces in the HUD when mixed in with the fake spaces intentionally inserted, (2) fixing our keydown handler to understand the scenario when we need to use the unicode keyIdentifier.

Refactor the command parser to not store invalid keys in the two-key buffer. Also, if the second key is itself a valid first key or a standalone command, keep it or execute it accordingly. Closes #20.
Fix bug where find mode HUD matched its own searches.
Add extra sanity checking to partially address issue #12 -- insert mode detection throws javascript error.
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/philc/vimium
Minor cleanup per Phil's comments.
Case-insensitive search.
First pass at find interface. Still needs some UI love and a highlight-all feature (maybe).
semicolon
Move the HUD over to the right for the time being -- it gets covered up by the status bar on the left.
First pass at a settings page. Hooked up scrollStepSize as our first setting.
Don't test the focusNode if there isn't one.
Refactor a bit to use new isInputOrText() function.
Enter insert mode if the content script loads with a text input already focused before we can add event handlers (e.g. google). Also blur the text box if the user exits insert mode. Closes #4.
Move processing of 'i' command out into background command processor. Closes #5.
Get rid of the toolstrip for now.
Implement 'gf' -- toggle view source for the current page.
Keep tab queue per-window instead of globally. This mirrors behavior in both Vim and Vimperator. Closes #2.
README
Implement forward and back in history.
Some cleanup.

Add a workaround for a chrome/webkit bug that gives back bad scrollTop data:
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=2891

There may still be another bug or some trickery needed to get proper scrollTop values all the time.
Save scroll position for removed tabs.
Small bugfix for bug introduced in last commit. Don't take any keystrokes besides ESC if insertMode is on.
Cleanup the code in the content script a bit.
String together some callbacks to properly execute multiple actions that are asynchronous. For example, there was a race between the tab remove call and the selection of a new tab.
Initial support for counts. Commands like '5j' and '5t' work pretty well. '5d' and '5u' need some love.
Implement basic tab restore functionality (the 'u' command).
Reload.
Implement basic h,j,k,l navigation and remove the unnecessary registry in the content script.
Clean up some code that's now unnecessary.
Simplify the registry in background_page a bit.
Add tab create and remove to the new system, disable the old system.
First pass at a better framework for mapping keys to commands.
